chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall a b x y : Z, gcdZ a b = IZ -> {z : Z | congruentZ z x a /\ congruentZ z y b}

Premises:
congruentZ = fun x y n : Z => divide Z IdZ multZ OZ n (addZ x (oppZ y)) : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop
gcdZ = fun a b : Z => pi1 Z (is_gcdZ a b) (gcdZ_exists a b) : Z -> Z -> Z
IZ = pos 0 : Z
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
is_gcdZ_sind : forall P : Z -> Z -> Z -> SProp, (forall b : Z, P OZ b (absZ b)) -> (forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> P r b d -> P b a d) -> forall z z0 z1 : Z, is_gcdZ z z0 z1 -> P z z0 z1
is_gcdZ_ind : forall P : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop, (forall b : Z, P OZ b (absZ b)) -> (forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> P r b d -> P b a d) -> forall z z0 z1 : Z, is_gcdZ z z0 z1 -> P z z0 z1
gcd_modZ : forall a b q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> gcdZ r b = gcdZ b a
gcdZ_is_gcdZ : forall a b d : Z, is_gcdZ a b d -> d = gcdZ a b
gcdZ_i : forall a b x : Z, is_gcdZ a b x -> {x : Z | is_gcdZ a b x}
Zdiv.Zdiv_eucl_exist : forall b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.gt b BinNums.Z0 -> forall a : BinNums.Z, {qr : BinNums.Z * BinNums.Z | let (q, r) := qr in a = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul b q) r /\ BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 r /\ BinInt.Z.lt r b}
Bezout_i : forall a b u v : Z, addZ (multZ a u) (multZ b v) = gcdZ a b -> verify_BezoutZ a b
Inductive verify_BezoutZ (a b : Z) : Set := Bezout_i : forall u v : Z, addZ (multZ a u) (multZ b v) = gcdZ a b -> verify_BezoutZ a b
is_diveuclZ = fun a b q r : Z => b <> OZ /\ leZ OZ r /\ ltZ r (absZ b) /\ a = addZ (multZ b q) r : Z -> Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop
Inductive is_gcdZ : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop := gcd_OZ : forall b : Z, is_gcdZ OZ b (absZ b) | gcd_mod : forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> is_gcdZ b a d
Zdiv.Z_div_mod : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.gt b BinNums.Z0 -> let (q, r) := BinInt.Z.div_eucl a b in a = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul b q) r /\ BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 r /\ BinInt.Z.lt r b
gcdZ_is_gcd : forall a b d : Z, is_gcdZ a b d -> is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d
verify_BezoutZ_rect : forall (a b : Z) (P : verify_BezoutZ a b -> Type), (forall (u v : Z) (e : addZ (multZ a u) (multZ b v) = gcdZ a b), P (Bezout_i a b u v e)) -> forall v : verify_BezoutZ a b, P v
verify_BezoutZ_sind : forall (a b : Z) (P : verify_BezoutZ a b -> SProp), (forall (u v : Z) (e : addZ (multZ a u) (multZ b v) = gcdZ a b), P (Bezout_i a b u v e)) -> forall v : verify_BezoutZ a b, P v
verify_BezoutZ_ind : forall (a b : Z) (P : verify_BezoutZ a b -> Prop), (forall (u v : Z) (e : addZ (multZ a u) (multZ b v) = gcdZ a b), P (Bezout_i a b u v e)) -> forall v : verify_BezoutZ a b, P v
verify_BezoutZ_rec : forall (a b : Z) (P : verify_BezoutZ a b -> Set), (forall (u v : Z) (e : addZ (multZ a u) (multZ b v) = gcdZ a b), P (Bezout_i a b u v e)) -> forall v : verify_BezoutZ a b, P v
gcd_unicity_apart_sign : forall a b d1 d2 : Z, is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d1 -> is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d2 -> d2 = d1 \/ d2 = oppZ d1
have_gcdZ = fun a b : Z => {d : Z | is_gcdZ a b d} : Z -> Z -> Set
unicity_is_gcdZ : forall a b d1 d2 : Z, is_gcdZ a b d1 -> is_gcdZ a b d2 -> d2 = d1
Zdiv.Zdiv_eucl_extended : forall b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> forall a : BinNums.Z, {qr : BinNums.Z * BinNums.Z | let (q, r) := qr in a = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul b q) r /\ BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 r /\ BinInt.Z.lt r (BinInt.Z.abs b)}
divZ : forall a b : Z, b <> OZ -> diveuclZ a b
divexZ : forall a b q r : Z, is_diveuclZ a b q r -> diveuclZ a b
multZ_neutral = conj I (fun (x : Z) (_ : IdZ x) => conj (eq_ind (multZ IZ x) (fun z : Z => z = x) eq_refl (multZ x IZ) (multZ_commutativity IZ x)) eq_refl) : neutral Z IdZ multZ IZ
gcd_unicity_apart_unities : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Add Mult : S -> S -> S) (O I : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_unitary_commutative_ring S A Add Mult O I Opp -> integrity S Mult O -> forall a b d1 d2 : S, is_gcd S A Mult O a b d1 -> is_gcd S A Mult O a b d2 -> exists x : S, inversible S Mult I x /\ A x /\ d2 = Mult d1 x
gcd_mod : forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> is_gcdZ b a d

```coq
intros a b x y H.
assert (H_gcdZ: exists d, is_gcdZ a b d) by (apply have_gcdZ).
destruct H_gcdZ as [d Hd].
assert (H_Bezout: verify_BezoutZ a b) by (apply Bezout_i with (u:=0) (v:=1); rewrite H; auto).
apply verify_BezoutZ_ind with (P:=fun v=>exists z, congruentZ z x a /\ congruentZ z y b) in H_Bezout.
intros u v e.
exists (addZ (multZ a u) (multZ b v)).
split; apply congruentZ_intro.
- rewrite <- e; rewrite H; auto.
- rewrite <- e; rewrite H; auto.
Qed.```

original: intros a b x y H. assert (H_gcdZ: exists d, is_gcdZ a b d) by (apply have_gcdZ). destruct H_gcdZ as [d Hd]. assert (H_Bezout: verify_BezoutZ a b) by (apply Bezout_i with (u:=0) (v:=1); rewrite H; auto). apply verify_BezoutZ_ind with (P:=fun v=>exists z, congruentZ z x a /\ congruentZ z y b) in H_Bezout. intros u v e. exists (addZ (multZ a u) (multZ b v)). split; apply congruentZ_intro. - rewrite <- e; rewrite H; auto. - rewrite <- e; rewrite H; auto.
